page.title: 16LUCKINGTON IN 1945.
page.content: There was one village shop and two Public houses, the Ship and the Bell,(the latter was housed in the building adjacent to the present post office.)The village was much quieter,less traffic,a horse-drawn bus went from the Ship to Sherston to Yate.There were no bathrooms, no electricity,the only water came from the Pump House.No wireless, only weekly newspapers.Regular garden parties were held to raise money for the village hall.Local children were given half pence to deliver groceries.The River Avon was the water supply during droughts.There was a small pottery firm outside the village.50 to 70 pupils attended the village school.There were three teachers at the school.
